newsitem.title: UK: Shell says only Bonny exports may be disrupted.
newsitem.headline: Shell says only Bonny exports may be disrupted.

text.p: Royal Dutch/Shell said a precautionary notice of force majeure on Nigerian crude exports in April issued on Wednesday applies only to the Bonny crude stream and not Forcados.
"We believe we can meet our Forcados commitments for the foreseeable future," said a Shell spokesman.
"For Bonny, we're still hopeful that it won't have to be applied," he said.

Bonny production has been reduced by 110,000 barrels per day (bpd) since Saturday when local residents forced the closure of five flow stations in the Nembe Creek area in the eastern Niger Delta region.
Shell said it was still unclear when it would be able to resume operations at the four Nembe Creek stations and the nearby Odeama One station.
"The agreement was that we would shut them down and evacuate," said a Shell spokesman, adding talks were continuing with local community leaders.
Shell also lost 100,000 bpd of production on the Forcados system west of the Niger river when six flow stations were occupied last weekend.
